verses.verse: {Bildad Speaks a Third Time} d Bildad from Shuah responded and said:
"Dominion and fear belong to God; {Lit. him} who fashions peace in his high heaven.
Is there any limit to his armies? On whom does his light not shine? {Lit. rise}
How can a human being {Lit. man} become right with God? How can a human being {Lit. can one born of a woman} be pure?
Behold, even the moon isn't bright, and the stars aren't pure in his eyes.
How much less is man, who is only a maggot, or a man's children, who are only worms!"
